headline.main: Ill Effects Force Easing of Ban on Prison Smoking

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's only complete ban on smoking in prison, imposed by Vermont at its six corrections centers and two county lockups last summer, created so many problems that the state has now been forced to ease it. Vermont imposed the statewide ban in July to counter indoor air pollution and to head off lawsuits by nonsmoking prisoners over the dangers of secondhand smoke.
